articles.headline: Endowments Boom as Colleges Bury Earnings Overseas
articles.snippet: American universities are using offshore strategies to swell their coffers, skirt taxes and obscure investments that could spark campus protests.
articles.abstract: American universities are using offshore strategies to swell their coffers, skirt taxes and obscure investments that could spark campus protests.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2006, the endowments of Indiana University and Texas Christian University invested millions of dollars in a partnership, hoping to mint riches from oil, gas and coal.

articles.headline: Targeting China’s Purchases, Congress Proposes Tougher Reviews of Foreign Investments
articles.snippet: Members of the House and Senate proposed more stringent reviews of Chinese investments, even as President Trump traveled to Beijing to announce new deals.
articles.abstract: Members of the House and Senate proposed more stringent reviews of Chinese investments, even as President Trump traveled to Beijing to announce new deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — China has been a tricky economic partner for the United States, offering both lucrative opportunities for collaboration and a minefield of security risks.

articles.headline: Justice Department Says Not So Fast to AT&T’s Time Warner Bid
articles.snippet: CNN, a network criticized by Trump, figures in a dispute between the government and AT&T, setting up a battle over the pending $85.4 billion deal.
articles.abstract: CNN, a network criticized by Trump, figures in a dispute between the government and AT&T, setting up a battle over the pending $85.4 billion deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: It seemed like a match made in media heaven. AT&T is a telecommunications giant whose reach stretches to millions of people all over the country, and Time Warner, the owner of CNN, HBO and Warner Bros., has content galore. Together, the two companies would create a colossus straddling the worlds of internet access, news and entertainment.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced, Emily Steel, Andrew Ross Sorkin and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: Suburbs Rebel Against Trump, Threatening Republicans in Congress
articles.snippet: Suburban areas appear to be in open revolt against President Trump, with a coalition of educated whites and minorities shunning Republican candidates.
articles.abstract: Suburban areas appear to be in open revolt against President Trump, with a coalition of educated whites and minorities shunning Republican candidates.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — The American suburbs appear to be in revolt against President Trump after a muscular coalition of college-educated voters and racial and ethnic minorities dealt the Republican Party a thumping rejection on Tuesday and propelled a diverse class of Democrats into office.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: YouTube’s Rapid Response Partisans Game the News of Tragedy
articles.snippet: A community of internet talking heads gets their fact-challenged messages across by working fast after events like the church massacre in Texas.
articles.abstract: A community of internet talking heads gets their fact-challenged messages across by working fast after events like the church massacre in Texas.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Sunday afternoon, when Elmer T. Williams’s wife told him that a mass shooting had taken place at a church in Texas, he leapt into action. First, he skimmed a handful of news stories about the massacre. Then, when he felt sufficiently informed, he went into his home video studio, put on his trademark aviator sunglasses, and hit record.

articles.headline: Senate Republicans Will Diverge From House in Sweeping Tax Rewrite
articles.snippet: The Senate will diverge from the House legislation in several key ways, including eliminating the ability to deduct state and local taxes and scaling back, rather than ending, the estate tax.
articles.abstract: The Senate will diverge from the House legislation in several key ways, including eliminating the ability to deduct state and local taxes and scaling back, rather than ending, the estate tax.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans, under pressure to pass a sweeping tax rewrite before year’s end, are expected to unveil legislation on Thursday that would eliminate the ability of people to deduct state and local taxes but would stop short of fully repealing the estate tax, according to lobbyists and other people familiar with the bill.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley, Alan Rappeport and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: After Massacre, a Small Texas Cemetery Strains to Bury So Many Dead
articles.snippet: The cemetery in the small Texas town where 26 were killed in a church shooting will see more funerals in the coming days than it does in a typical year.
articles.abstract: The cemetery in the small Texas town where 26 were killed in a church shooting will see more funerals in the coming days than it does in a typical year.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUTHERLAND SPRINGS, Tex. — Families have buried their dead, one by one, in the cemetery on the edge of town since the 1850s, when a settler named Dr. John Sutherland put down stakes on an old Spanish land grant.

articles.headline: In AT&T Deal, Government Action Catches Up With Trump Rhetoric
articles.snippet: CNN is at the heart of a dispute between the Justice Department and AT&T and Time Warner, raising the possibility of interference by President Trump.
articles.abstract: CNN is at the heart of a dispute between the Justice Department and AT&T and Time Warner, raising the possibility of interference by President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Oct. 22, 2016, Donald J. Trump made his own history in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, where he was holding a campaign rally just weeks before his election.

articles.headline: Trump, Aiming to Coax Xi Jinping, Bets on Flattery
articles.snippet: President Trump projected an air of deference to China that was almost unheard-of for a visiting American leader.
articles.abstract: President Trump projected an air of deference to China that was almost unheard-of for a visiting American leader.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — President Trump heaped praise on President Xi Jinping of China on Thursday, blaming past American administrations for China’s yawning trade surplus with the United States and saying he was confident that Mr. Xi could defuse the threat from North Korea.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler, Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Jane Perlez
